intro: Eulophia lokobensis, commonly known as the Lokobé orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect growth habit with long, narrow leaves. The plant produces striking inflorescences with numerous small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale green. Eulophia lokobensis thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a notable species within its native ecosystem.
